Articles.Content:
So as it turns out, my mod has a few issues. For example, even with a texture, the gas planet is completely black as seen in the images below

Spoiler

Gas giant config below

Spoiler

Edit: When placing a regular Jool, it seems to be illuminated correctly

Spoiler

Second edit: This issue happens when I apply the texture to the ScaledVersion.

Here is my texture below:

Spoiler

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Y0DOF3emAgRnWIkG-cwTLyxmzv3KronC/view

Third edit: Something was likely wrong with my texture. OPM Urlum's texture worked, but when I tried to use the Ignis texture, it did the same glitch.

Edited June 2 by users14
How are you saving your texture, i.e. file type, compression, etc.?

9 minutes ago, OhioBob said:

How are you saving your texture, i.e. file type, compression, etc.?

I'm using GIMP to do so, and from what I know, I used DTX5 compression and exported it with GIMP as a DDS. There are also mipmaps, and I'll try disabling mipmaps and see if it works.

Edit: After removing mipmaps, it works perfectly

Edited June 2 by users14

27 minutes ago, OhioBob said:

Try DXT1 with mipmaps.

Mipmaps with DTX1 also causes the same issue. I can live without mipmaps, though.

12 hours ago, users14 said:

Mipmaps with DTX1 also causes the same issue. I can live without mipmaps, though.

That's strange.  I've never had mipmaps cause an issue like that.  Generally mipmaps are recommended for color maps.
Edit: So it turns out, the main issue was the specular color, and not mipmaps.
